pros:
I am left to my own devices when it comes to organizing and designing the layout of the shop so I have made it very much my own. 
I get the opportunity to educate people who come through my department and work with some really creative and inspiring  individuals.
cons: While my shop hours are flexible and fit my schedule during the weeks where all of our shows go up it is mandatory that I be present at strikes and load ins which at times conflicts with other events going on or can at times feel as though it is unnecessary that I be present.

pros: The best of the students are some of the smartest, most passionate and enthusiastic young men and women I’ve ever had The pleasure of knowing. A good percentage of the staff are absolute sweethearts, knowledgeable and very capable of doing their jobs well beyond expectations. The faculty is a mixed bag, but tends to have a high concentration of PhDs who have a passion for teaching and supporting student growth as best they know how.
cons: While the high end of the bell curve yields an incredible caliber of people worth knowing, the average across faculty and staff is a group of disappointed and disappointing profesionals who suffer from some blend of apathy, egocentrism, pride, and such emotional and personal baggage that professional mistakes are seen as personal grievances and grudges can magnify the difficulty of the working world by an unimaginable level. Politics reign supreme, and the most important thing to achieving a decent professional life is never upsetting anyone and being good at your job but not so good that you are recognized for it. In the event that you are that good, you will subsequently find yourself doing the work of others who have become professional nesters capable of seemingly little beyond keeping their jobs. This problem isn’t personal, it’s universal to an institution that neither recognizes nor encourages excellence among the professionals. At this point, I’m not sure that folks even know how to recognize good work as anything other than something to be wary of.

pros: Wide range of writers, lots of opportunities for talented individuals, competent staff, great faculty adviser.
cons: Pay is peanuts, weekly staff meetings can be inconvenient, weekly "article of the week" awards are just popularity contests.

review_title: Recent Changes in Department Structure Make for Chaotic Work Environment
pros: Encourages development of time management, community building, and confrontation mediation skills.
cons: Major night and weekend time commitment not reflected in level of pay. Recent changes in the structure of the department due to budget cuts make for chaotic work environment.
